channel.title: Java logic
channel.description: Will this work correctly? If i remember correctly They are red from Right to Left, so in theory "currentOffset" should be the id prior to the reading 2 bytes, which is what i want to happen. Can someone verify this for me? Just want a second opinion, because i dont know if it works this way for setting values. [code]itemArrayIndex[itemStream.readUnsignedWord()] = itemStream.currentOffset;//itemID[/code] will it be same result as this? [code] int offset = itemStream.currentOffset; itemArrayIndex[itemStream.readUnsignedWord()] = offset; [/code]

item.title: Java logic
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

It compiles down to something similar to:

GETSTATIC Test2.itemArrayIndex : [I INVOKESTATIC Test2.readWord ()I GETSTATIC Test2.currentOffset : I IASTORE

So yes, it will change current offset before you can store it.

Read full topic

item.title: Java logic
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

You should be banned from the help section, useless response.
I was asking because of the method on the left will change the currentOffset from the value i want. I just didnt know which would happen first.

Read full topic

Will this work correctly? If i remember correctly They are red from Right to Left, so in theory “currentOffset” should be the id prior to the reading 2 bytes, which is what i want to happen. Can someone verify this for me? Just want a second opinion, because i dont know if it works this way for setting values.
